SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the reader

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because individuals who have lived in various parts of the province may have had different experiences. Others may have had similar experiences but in different places.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who have lived in Western Canada before 1941, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer era.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should fill them out separately or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Western Plains: What Did You Do?", is still being answered. If you have not already answered this, please do so by placing a check mark here.

If one will be shown to you at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer business, trade and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience

Erasure of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Branches. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces or answers. It is better to give whatever information you have about each subject than to leave it blank.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family has answered the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or reply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Have?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here (+) and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires relating to:

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer living conditions
- Pioneer building
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of our permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life in such a manner that all individuals who are asked to answer it have exactly the same experiences as answers. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

Members of pioneer families are encouraged to answer these questions, even if they do not have personal experience of the pioneer years. Whether or not they have personal experience, they should write them on separate sheets or copy them for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Tales: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Have to Say?" will be prepared at Saskatchewan Archives and will be sent to you.
